section.title: Creating a Windows Template
section.para: Windows templates must be prepared with Sysprep before they can be provisioned on multiple machines. Sysprep allows you to create a generic Windows template and avoid any possible SID conflicts.

note.para: (XenServer) Windows VMs running on XenServer require PV drivers, which may be provided in the template or added after the VM is created. The PV drivers are necessary for essential management functions such as mounting additional volumes and ISO images, live migration, and graceful shutdown.

section.para: An overview of the procedure is as follows:

listitem.para: Create a VM Instance with this ISO.
Follow the steps in Sysprep for Windows Server 2008 R2 (below) or Sysprep for Windows Server 2003 R2, depending on your version of Windows Server
The preparation steps are complete. Now you can actually create the template as described in Creating the Windows Template.
